summary: The Department of Defense receives about $95 billion annually to fund research and development. But the process to request and allocate these funds generally takes about 2 years—which can hinder DOD's ability to support technological innovations. So Congress allowed DOD some flexibility to decide how to use certain funds. For example, one flexibility allows lab directors to support early research that wouldn't otherwise receive funding...
title: Research and Development: DOD Benefited from Financial Flexibilities but Could Do More to Maximize Their Use
